title: Drawing, "Botanical Studies made from the Rio Magdalena, Colombia:  Parasite, Dead Tree", 1853
markings: Watermark: Parts of the letters K and F. Similar to -104.
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, at upper left: Parts strongly marked pale pure yellow green / other leaves ordinary; at upper center:  Parasite rich green / Dead tree/ leaves at least three / feet long; at top right: Network / of vines / - dead - ;at lower left: Vines growing / up on the stems of the rope vine; at lower center:  High tree [struck out: 'with'] in flower, closely resembles / the chestnut; at lower right: dead top of tree;  and again at lower center: top of tree.
description: Horizontal view of botanical studies of Columbia plants and trees.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Botanical Studies made from the Rio Magdalena, Colombia:  Parasite, Dead Tree", 1853.
1853. Graphite on gray wove paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-98.
